email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Halloween biscuits next to an October 2020 calendar page
image.title: Boo!

email.text:
Hi everyone!
We hope you‚Äôve had a great week and enjoyed our events!
In the upcoming week we're bringing you an Escape Room Night and exciting events with our sponsors - G-Research and London Stock Exchange Group.
email.heading: Escape Room Night

event.text:
Come and Join DoCSoc in the first ever ESCAPE ROOM NIGHT!! Come register as a team and go head-to-head with other teams to escape FIRST! There will be two types of Escape Rooms to chose from and winners might have some prizes coming their way üëÄ
Each team is only allowed to have a maximum of 6 people! Make sure you register your team before the event.
Event will take place on the DoCSoc Microsoft Teams Team. Register [here](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=B3WJK4zudUWDC0-CZ8PTB4BymOWFa9VFtQLZQgz9br9UMjJHRlpFOElFMk9OSFc3NFJQRTNKQ0g3WC4u).

email.heading: G-Research Coding Challenge

event.text:
Join us for the G-Research Coding Challenge, where you'll compete in teams in a series ofprogressively more difficult software development challenges.
Tuesday 27th October, 6:00 - 8:00 pm (GMT)
Open to CompSci/Mathematics students in their penultimate or final years, the event will have teams of 3-5 people competing to build a natural language calculation engine (no prior NLP experience required). The challenges will cover things like evaluation of arithmetic expressions to unit conversions and equation solving.
To register, just fill out the form at http://bit.ly/gr-coding-challenge-oct. Wewill allocate teams the week before the event (or if you would like to join asa team with friends, just let us know when you register).
Please note, you will need a fully charged laptop, a good internet connection, Chrome or Safari, and headphones to take part.
Once you have registered you will receive a unique link to join the event which you should use to log in by 5:45 pm (GMT), so that you can meet your teammates and learn how to navigate the online event space. More information on the event will be emailed to you one day before.
Once the game is complete, you will have the opportunity to stay online for some virtual networking where you can discuss the event and life at G-Research with members of our team.
We'll be handing out prizes to the top three teams, with each member getting an Amazon voucher (¬£50 for first, ¬£25 forsecond, ¬£10 for third).

email.heading: DoCSoc x LSEG: My Journey to the London Stock Exchange Group

event.text:
London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) has a long, prestigious heritage that few organisations can rival, dating back to 1698. Since then, we‚Äôve grown to become one of the world‚Äôs foremost financial market infrastructure and capital markets groups. As a global leader in financial technology, LSEG continues to play a pivotal role within the financial markets during these challenging and unprecedented times.
Join Ziyou Zang, a Technology Graduate in Enterprise Cloud for a LSEG Virtual Event with the Imperial College DoCSoc on 29th October from 6pm‚Äì8pm to find out about Ziyou‚Äôs journey to LSEG. Ziyou recently graduated from Imperial College in 2020 with a MSc in Computer Science. You‚Äôll get the chance to put your questions to Ziyou & an Early Years Careers Lead as well as learning more about how you can shape the future of LSEG through our technology spring week, internship and graduate programmes.
Join Zoom Meeting:
https://lseg.zoom.us/j/88429687188?pwd=QUpWNU90WEpWT2dpNzlFeVlmbzNGQT09
Meeting ID: `884 2968 7188`
Passcode: `5KeeFk`

email.heading: Python 101

event.text:
One of the key attributes DoCSoc hosts is the Python 101 Introductory Workshop for not only DoC students, but all members of Imperial College London. We invite everyone from any disciplines and level of education. This will be a beginners level course for anyone who has very little to none knowledge in Python. Please click "Going" on Facebook so we can estimate the size of the interactive workshops.
Dates: every Tuesday 4-6pm GMT from Oct 20th to Nov 24th.
This week's lecture will be on control flow (if statements, for and while loops), lists and list comprehensions.

email.heading: Graphcore - Poplar SDK 1.3 Released
email.sponsor:
**Poplar SDK 1.3 Released**
![Poplar SDK 1.3 Released](https://www.graphcore.ai/hs-fs/hubfs/Graphcore%20releases%20Poplar%20SDK%201.3%20version.jpg)
We just released Poplar SDK 1.3 which includes multiple optimisations and new features to help IPU developers run their ML models faster and more efficiently. We also launched [version 2.1 of the PopVision‚Ñ¢ Graph Analyser Tool](https://www.graphcore.ai/posts/major-update-released-for-poplar-application-analysis-tool).
Read the blog [here](https://www.graphcore.ai/posts/graphcore-releases-new-poplar-sdk-1.3).
email.heading: LSEG - WIN Breakfast Series
email.sponsor:
**The history of London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) can be traced all the way back to 1698. The financial markets have evolved significantly since then, and so too has the nature of our business. LSEG has grown to become one of the world‚Äôs foremost financial markets infrastructure groups, and a globally recognised leader in emerging financial technology, or FinTech.**
Join the LSEG Women‚Äôs Inspire Network (WIN) for a **series of interactive sessions** that will give you a greater insight into our work at the centre of financial markets. As well as hearing from senior leaders on specific topics, you will have the opportunity to network with representatives within LSEG and learn more about the opportunities that we offer.
SUSTAINABLE INVESTMENT 26 October, 09:30‚Äì10:30
TECHNOLOGY 27 October, 09:30‚Äì10:30
POST TRADE 29 October, 09:30‚Äì10:30
This unique opportunity to hear from and network with our WIN members is open to students interested in applying to our graduate and intern programmes. To register for these events click [here](https://www2.lseg.com/WIN-breakfast-series); registration for each event will close five days before the event.
To discover more about our programmes and to apply, visit www.lseg.com/graduates.
email.heading: Palantir‚Äôs Virtual Puzzlehunt
email.sponsor:
Hello!
We invite you to participate in Palantir‚Äôs first Virtual Puzzlehunt happening on Saturday 31 October. Registration is now open, please read on to learn more about what puzzlehunt is and how you can participate!
Date: 31 October
Time: 1:00 PM London time
Website: https://palantirpuzzlehunt.com/foodforthought/
What is a puzzlehunt?
Think of a puzzlehunt as a treasure hunt where you need to solve a puzzle in order to move on to the next location. Each puzzle usually solves to a single word or short phrase and can range from your standard logic puzzles, knowledge of idioms, to finding clues in a set of pictures.Teams of 4-6 people will go (virtually) from location to location competing against other teams all around the world! The goal is to finish each puzzle in the shortest amount of time possible. There will be a winning team for each individual puzzle, and then a winning team of the entire puzzlehunt.
What should I know about the event?
The hunt will kick off at 1:00 PM London time. We will begin the event with a brief kickoff where we‚Äôll share an overview of the event, what to expect, and how to request help throughout the hunt.If you have to join later than 1:00 PM London time, that is okay! Just note that there will only be live support from 1:00-9:00 PM London time. The length of the hunt is about 8 hours, but teams can skip certain puzzles if they‚Äôd like to shorten the event to about 4 hours instead. The hunt will be in English.
How do we sign up?
To register once you‚Äôve assembled your gang of motley puzzle solvers, have one person go to the website (palantirpuzzlehunt.com) and register a team username and password which will be a shared login for everyone on the team. You will need a hunt code to register. The hunt code is ‚ÄúON YOUR MARKS‚Äù. You can enter all your team members when you register the team or login and add them afterwards. Registration will be closing on Friday, 29 October at 10:00 PM London time.
If you have any questions about the hunt or the registration process, send us an email at foodforthought@palantir.com.
Thanks, and we hope to see you there!
